summary_reasoning: The report makes several key inputs explicit and proximate to the forecasts (revenue CAGR, margin trajectory, WACC, terminal growth, FY2025/2029 revenue, EPS), and provides specific magnitudes with time horizons. However, justification is weak: drivers are largely attributed to “AI and cloud” tailwinds without multi-year historical evidence, peer benchmarks, or sourced parameter derivations (e.g., WACC and terminal growth rationales are cursory). Internal consistency is problematic with at least two numeric contradictions: the stated 20% revenue CAGR (and 20–25% growth through 2027) conflicts with the Financials Snapshot and the implied 2025–2029 growth path to $16.1B (~15% CAGR), and WACC at 9% is inconsistent with a 10% cost of equity and “no debt.” Stress-testing is limited but present: revenue downside of 10–15% and a 2% WACC swing changing valuation by 20% are quantified; yet there is no sensitivity on terminal growth, margins, or share count, nor valuation impacts across scenarios. Several material assumptions are missing/opaque (tax rate, capex/working capital, share count/dilution). Given the contradictions and incomplete sensitivities, the quality of assumptions is poor under the stated decision rules.

assumptions_extracted.quote: We model FY2025 revenue at $9.2 billion, implying 22.7% growth from an estimated FY2024 base
Our discounted cash flow model assumes a 20% revenue CAGR from FY2025 to FY2029, driven by AI and cloud expansion, reaching $16.1 billion by FY2029.
We project operating margins expanding to 42% by FY2029 from 40% in FY2025
WACC is 9.0%, incorporating a 10% cost of equity and beta of 1.2.
Valuation implies a forward P/E of 45x our FY2026 EPS estimate of $11.10
Macro risks include economic slowdowns reducing IT spending, potentially cutting revenue by 10%-15%.
a 2% WACC change swings valuation by 20%.

contradictions.description: Revenue growth stated as 20% CAGR (and 20–25% annually through 2027) conflicts with the Financials Snapshot and reaching $16.1B from $9.2B (~15% CAGR).
WACC 9.0% with cost of equity 10% and no debt implies WACC below COE, which is inconsistent for an unlevered firm.

unjustified_parameters: Revenue CAGR 20% without reconciliation to tables
Operating margin expansion to 42% without historical/peer support
